page.title: 15BRIGHTON ROCK.
page.content: In 1938 the novelist Graham Greene wrote a book, which characterised one side of life in Brighton at the time. Greene had visited Brighton many times - during the period of poverty and depression preceding World War II. Unemployment was at 5% or a total of 5,000 in the town.There were street fights between the Fascists and the unemployed, throughout these hard times.The violence rate in Brighton was also high associated frequently with the viciousness of the race-course as gangs offered "protection" to bookmakers and took their vengeance with razors or blackmail. The opening sentence of the book begins with Hale, a newspaper journalist..."Hale knew they meant to murder him before he had been in Brighton three hours...."
